intro: Allosorus stelleri, commonly known as the Steller's alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes Mountains. It is a perennial herb with a rosette of basal leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. The plant is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and thrives in rocky or alpine soils. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Allosorus stelleri is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms.
